message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as it proposes a framework for inferring user preferences by performing probabilistic first-order logical reasoning over the social network graph. It also uses semi-supervised data harvesting and vector space models to extract user attributes and preferences from text. 

It could also belong to cs.SOC (Computational Social Science) as it deals with analyzing social networks and user preferences. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it uses probabilistic reasoning to infer user preferences. 

It may also fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it uses machine learning techniques such as distant supervision and semi-supervised learning to extract user attributes and preferences. 

Finally, it could be categorized under cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing techniques to extract user attributes and preferences from text.
